Many 3rd parties, who created their app on an open Twitter API, later had to contend with Twitter slowly cutting off access to more and more info. Faced with this, some (like Twint) moved to scraping the mobile interface instead of dealing with a stingy API.

Twitter has spent the past week or so slowly crippling the developer ecosystem, I have heard about issues with Tweetbot, twint, and now with blocklists. If their plan to prepare for the election is to cripple all APIs and 3rd-party devs... it isnâ€™t much of a plan. https://t.co/RhqTNw2SQh
